meanings.sent1: She decided to sublate the unnecessary items from her room to create more space.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to sublate the incorrect answers from their papers.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he tried to sublate the vegetables from his plate when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to sublate all the worries and doubts from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to sublate the coin from one hand to the other, leaving the audience amazed.

meanings.sent1: The judge had to sublate the unfair decision made by the jury.
meanings.sent2: The company had to sublate the contract due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to sublate the meeting, but everyone knew it was important.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to sublate all the plans for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news seemed to sublate all the excitement from the room.

meanings.definition: To elevate or raise to a higher level
meanings.sent1: The mentor's guidance helped sublate her skills to a professional level.
meanings.sent2: The promotion would sublate his position within the company.
meanings.sent3: The new technology aimed to sublate the user experience to a whole new level.
meanings.sent4: Her determination seemed to sublate her performance to extraordinary heights.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountain peak seemed to sublate all her previous hiking experiences.
